website_summaries.verdict: If you're after a wide and long lens and excellent photo quality, the Canon PowerShot SX40 HS is a standout. In features, design, and performance, though, it's a bit lacking.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX40 HS has a flexible lens range, very good image stabilization, excellent photo quality for its class, and shooting modes for every kind of user
cons: The SX40 HS's shooting performance lags behind that of the competition and has a couple potentially irritating design points

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started a Youtube channel and I was looking for a quality camera at a reasonable price! I am soo happy I came across this camera! The quality is excellent! It is very easy to operate! I am still having issues figuring out the lighting but I’m working on that! ha! The seller was very easy to work with and I received my product in a day or two! I am very happy with my purchase! This review is very late as I ordered the camera months ago! However, after all this time I am still very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie S.

customer_reviews.title: I am not a camera expert but I like to take pictures at concerts
customer_reviews.text: I am not a camera expert but I like to take pictures at concerts. The spot metering allows me to get great shots in a variety of settings and at long distances and the size and weight allow me to carry the camera inside a medium size purse. I don't know about aperture and all those fancy terms. All I know is that I get beautiful pictures even from far away with this camera. The picture of Paul McCartney was taken from the side section about halfway back in the arena using spot metering. The picture of Ringo was taken from the front row.
customer_reviews.author: Autumngal

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this camera. One real plus is that you have a view finder which are almost things of the past! It also has the versatility of a digital screen too. Does well in low light. The zoom is amazing too. I will probably never use all its features. My husband uses it as a point and shoot to photograph the weddings I officiate for my blog posts. Have been through many cameras through the years and we like this one the best. I was able to buy an instruction book separately that fit in the camera case.
customer_reviews.author: Mk Middleton

customer_reviews.title: I bought this camera refurbished & I love it. It came right on schedule with all ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera refurbished & I love it. It came right on schedule with all things included in the box (wall charger, USB, disc, camera strap). I got it to take pics & video of our new baby on the way so I'm super excited to start using it.
customer_reviews.author: blambright

customer_reviews.title: Best Vlogging Camera For the Money
customer_reviews.text: well exceeded my expectations i mainly got the camera for youtube and it works great the video quality is amazing and the on board mic is great as well. i am very happy
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Used Canon, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I got it used and the item just as the seller described. The last time I had a camera was the Canon T3 so this is a great replacement. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: Canon SX 40 HS
customer_reviews.text: I sold my Rebel 2Ti and simplified to this camera. An excellent unit with really good battery life and an amazing array of features for the price. I am very pleased. The low light capabilities and custom settings are amazing and user friendly. I highly recommend this unit to anyone looking for a capable alternative to a high priced DSLR. Took some zoom shots of the moon the other night that were so good, people didn't believe I took them. BTW - do not waste your money on the laminated cheat sheet that Amazon sells. It's not worth it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S

customer_reviews.title: Really Great & Affordable
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for the price! I purchased it to film my Youtube videos and I actually made a review of the camera (MVGOLDIE on Youtube). The camera is amazing, the only con is that it doesn’t have an autofocus. But other than that, the camera is fantastic, the zoom is great and it has a bunch of options to change the brightness, contrast, etc. Highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MVGOLDIE

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. I have used it for over 3 years and could not be happier. I have taken over 10,000 pictures with it and as with every camera there is a learning curve. The focusing is the hardest part to get down, but the abilities of this point and shoot for $300 are incredible. Only drawback is night shooting for the moon, planets, or the borealis. The zoom, landscapes, portraits, wildlife scenes are all reasons to buy this camera for any person who likes taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Guyler

customer_reviews.title: amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nature and wildlife photographer; I use relatively inexpensive field cameras that I don't have to worry about trashing, that let me shoot wide angle, macro, and zoom without changing lens, and that are relatively light weight. I have worked with the Canon G6, G8, Pro 1, SX10, SX20, and SX30. All I can say about the SX40 is wow -- much better processor and good lens. Does macro at least as well as than the G6 and G8, out shines all the prior models in less than ideal light, and the output is rich in color and detail at all focal lengths. I think it competes well with many much more expensive cameras.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Just Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This camera exceeded my expectations and I am totally pleased with it. The Zoom has allowed me to take pictures that just weren't possible before. When at full zoom it is understandably difficult to stay on an object when not using a tripod due to movement. Couple that with an involuntary tremor in my left hand and it becomes quite difficult. With that in mind the "anti-shake" feature built in does it's job in spades. I'll never need to buy another camera since this one does it all including hi-def movies.
customer_reviews.author: RTexasF

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera, very Novice friendly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera with superior zoom features and this has it. I want to take great pictures but am not a Camera nut and for my simple mind, this allows a lot of flexibility without making too many demands. You cannot add any lenses but the effective 840mm zoom with image stabilization is very good. SCN mode is great for shooting landscapes, wildlife, foliage etc. Hope the camera lasts for several years. There is a lady from australia, Fatdragon (I kid you not) who has posted an excellent set of videos on how to use this camera on Youtube. [...]
customer_reviews.author: DesiBOOKworm

customer_reviews.title: Great at Recording Video
customer_reviews.text: I was on edge about what camera to buy for about a month. I wanted a camera for video recording and this camera is perfect. You get a lot for the low price this camera is. It shoots in 1080 HD which makes videos look great. It takes very good photos and the flip out screen is very useful when recording videos. I would definitely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Vlogs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for vlogs. Excellent quality despite being an older model. I bought mine used for just over $200 and it works excellent.
customer_reviews.author: katrina

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a  Canon camera that does it all
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Canon camera. 24mm to 800 + mm will take care of most photo opportunities. Good low light capabilities. Because the SX50HS has been released you can find a new SX40HS for a great price. I don't know how many people need a 1200mm telephoto. I don't. Thats the lens on the SX50HS. I sold my DSLR Canon T3 and all my telephoto equipment. Just a hassle changing one lens for another and them missing the moment for a great shot. This is a great all around camera. You can't go wrong with this camera by your side.
customer_reviews.author: Harold A. Bouton

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have spent almost a year looking at digital cameras. Several things I wanted are High quality Long zoom lens Viewfinder Ease of operation This camera has it all. I'm very satisfied with it and I like it more every time I use it. I most cases the AUTO function does a much better job than I can do in with manual settings. I did have a problem getting a good shot of a full moon. The autofocus seemed to have a problem. I switched to manual focus and was able to get a perfect shot. I would certainly recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D Adams

customer_reviews.title: Fills my needs
customer_reviews.text: As might be expected I am still in the learning curve with this camera, and what it is capable of. Some things I've had trouble understanding, such as when I first tried it for several days, I'd turn on the camera only to get the message, "lens problem, camera will now shut down." It literally froze and the only way I could get it to work is to remove the memory card and immediately re-insert it. After several days, it simply stopped doing it and I still don't know the origin of the problem. The other side of the coin is that I am learning more and more about it and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: or at least some of them are excellent but a stand a lone camera is my back-up ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item 2 or 3 years ago. I still depend on it when a smartphone fails. I have purchased many accessory items such as 3 very different tri-pods. The smartphone cameras, or at least some of them are excellent but a stand a lone camera is my back-up when a photo or video is important.
customer_reviews.author: brian toomey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera for Camera Newbie

I have never been able to get good night shots until now! :D The pictures turn out beautiful and the camera is pretty simple to use. It did take a bit to find out how to do video, but once we did, the videos turn out great as well. AWESOME BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Quality is horrible not worth is at all
customer_reviews.text: This camera is horrible. The quality is not good at all. You are better off trying to draw what your trying to take a picture of then using this camera. Would not recommend this camera for anyone not worth it at all. I was under the impression that the camera was good quality for the price I got it for. When I got this camera is was like chicken scratch. Would not recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: High end point and shoot and super zoom
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon and it has lived up to all my expectations. I was really thinking about a DSLR, but if I had bought a Rebel, I would still have to buy an additional lens to improve the versatility. This is one camera , with one lens that has the best of both worlds (close ups and extreme zooms). It is the best bridge between point and shoot and Extreme (Not Beginner) DSLR. I would definitely recommend this camera, before buying a beginner DSLR (although the manual settings are a bit limited). The image quality is great, and you will be impressed with the versatility.
customer_reviews.author: I. Nesbeth

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality photos.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has the SX30 model and this is even better at a lower price! Photos are sharp, battery lasts forever!!!!!!! Only negative thing I have found is the location of the check zoom button which allows you to instantly zoom back to find your moving subject if it leaves your current zoom area. With a little practice, I can keep from accidentally hitting it while lining up a shot. Zoom is incredible and the stabilization works very well. Hard to do better!
customer_reviews.author: Aviator

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clarity and detail... Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with my Canon SX40HS. It has met and exceeded my expectations. I shoot a lot of landscapes and it creates clear crisply focused images. If you use the SCN setting you get clarity throughout the photo from foreground to the deepest reaches of the photo. Color is great. It makes very good HDR images... that is how I edit most of my photos. Portraits are very crisp with excellent detail. I shoot it almost every day. I participate on an online social media website which displays people's photos and mine rate up there with the best of them!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Machuta

customer_reviews.title: A Near-Perfect Camera
customer_reviews.text: I almost gave up on Canon when my expensive Canon G12 died after less than two years, but this camera had too many wonderful features to pass up. I took it on a trip to Hawaii, and it took wonderful pictures. I have owned several Canon cameras and thought Canon infallible until my ill-fated Canon G12, but this camera has renewed my faith in the quality of Canon cameras. I just hope it doesn't die an early death like the G12. I wish it had a connection for a remote, but otherwise it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Offer

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot camera. Features are easy to learn. The optical telephoto is good. The digital telephoto is pixilllated. Must also use a tripod (expected). The only drawbacks are: (1) The camera must use its rechargeable power pack with no accommodation for batteries. (2) Auto-focus never seems to want to "lock-in". Just when the shot is framed and in focus, the auto-focus will start "searching", blurring everything. This can take some time and sometimes the shot is lost because of it.
customer_reviews.author: airhound

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great zoom
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning more and more about what all this camera can do. Coming from manual 35 mm, film camera to our first digital; this was the one I researched and found most capable for what I wanted. The zoom on this camera is excellent. The size is perfect for those wanting more than just a small pocket camera. Photo colors are sharply detailed for what I want. Just getting back into photography and starting with family and scenery shots, I find it's much more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mariel

customer_reviews.title: This camera has been my best camera ever.

When I found this one (I bought a SX40 HS to replace the old one but it is the newest model and it doesn't have the viewfinder). I was so happy when I found your site. This camera is great. Thank you. Your service was also prompt.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this camera because of the reviews and because I need something light weight that will "do it all" for an upcoming big trip. I have 2 DSLR's but with all the lenses that I would like to take and the amount of weight of either one, neither would be conducive to hike with. This little Camera, Canon XS40 HS, has a X35 optical zoom that is amazing. I have been practicing with it and it will certainly fit the need. Because it is so versatile, I will always have the lens I need ready to capture that great shot!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures at Full Zoom Use
customer_reviews.text: One of the most impressive things about this camera is its ability to take good pictures even with the lens extended out to its full capability. Picture quality is good and I chose this camera because it had good low light quality pictures compared to some similar price range cameras. customer_reviews.author: KB_Albany

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera-  zoom & photo quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been searching for a camera with a great zoom and photo quality. I am so glad I found this! The newer version Of this model has an "even skin tone" setting which would be nice but I can photo shop if need be. Overall, amazing zoom & photo quality, even in the auto mode!
customer_reviews.author: DB56

customer_reviews.title: The seller Borgia1982 is horrible

customer_reviews.author: James Swick

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera. We were amazed that you could get sharp pictures with the zoom at 100%. We got GREAT shots while on a trip to the Galapagos. We like the camera so much that when the new model came out (50X zoom that shoots raw) we bought it. Sold this one to a friend. My husband is a photographer, so he really wanted the newer one because it shot raw. He has an expensive professional camera and actually used mine when things were pretty far away!
customer_reviews.author: Gail Young

customer_reviews.title: Very excitied
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this camera. It is so very easy to use. The zoom is amazing an very clear. Even after you zoom and take a picture you can zoom in in the picture. I zoomed in on a license plate from across the soccer field. After I took a picture I was able to zoom in even closer and see the tags on the plate. I did it just to see if it would. Amazing. I also bought a 8g memory card to go along with it as the camera does not come with one. Happy Shopping!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: A Great Point and Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this has been an amazing camera for our family. We enjoy the ease of a point and shoot, so that is a plus, but we are also very impressed with the pictures. I would consider this as a nice step up from a pocket sized point and shoot before moving up to the expensive SLR cameras. It has a lot of nice features. We've been using in a couple of years now, so I am sure Canon has a newer model, but this one was excellent for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nefarious Oldman

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first larger digital camera but many of my family members have professional cameras.I am very happy with my purchase because this camera has a GREAT zoom.The batter has a 4-5 hour batter life if it is one all the time. The only thing i am not fond of is the time it takes to focus in on something far away,If you are zoomed in on something and than if you move you might miss your picture of a rare bird siting of the fence of the white house.If i am zooming in on something far i use my tripod, so it would be a good idea to purchase one with this camera.I give this camera 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is incredible! It's like nothing is out of range. With the 35x optical zoom, you can even take cool pictures of the moon. The shutter speed is really fast. It has a very fast shutter speed which is great for action shots. Nature shots are clear and the colors are accurate. I can't say enough how good this camera is. I got it when Amazon was having a sale which saved me quite a bit of money. If interested, check daily. The prices always fluctuate, and maybe you can get a good deal like I did.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Pietura

customer_reviews.title: Grat camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with loads of features...not being a guy who likes to read instruction manuals I watched the excellent tutorial on You Tube to get started...metering and picture quality is excellent..the only knock I have is cycle recovery time after shooting a picture w/o flash in low light conditions...it is a great back up camera for me and I take it everywhere with me....the digital zoom sucks but you can block it so you only stay in optical zoom...best pictures in the zoom mode come with the best lighting..I love this little camera
customer_reviews.author: Jim Messer

customer_reviews.title: Over a year old and still taking excellent pics with good zooming
customer_reviews.text: Great price, feels nice in the grip, takes excellent zoom in shots even from afar, excellent colors even in low light indoor settings and magnificent outdoor shots... and this is all just using the autozoom function! Video is great and can zoom in and out also while taking the shot. Battery life is good and got one extra battery just in case and a 16 GB class 10 memory card and love this camera! Price was right and quality overall is top notch as expected from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: biggyboy1

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Zoom
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Canon SX40 we have bought. Features we like best are its tremendous zoom, handy size/weight and huge number of shots per battery charge
customer_reviews.author: CJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Happy Photo Snapper!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally in Love with this product!! It is amazingly beginner-friendly. I have waited years to get a really good camera and this is it! I am having so much fun with this Canon SX40. I am still learning but this camera's pictures are awesome even though I am not completely familiar with all of it's setting, the pictures still come out great! Thanks! Sincerely, ~ One Very Satisfied Canon Customer!!
customer_reviews.author: Tari Bramlett

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and awesome photos!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this camera and love it! The photos it takes are very clear and love the zoom. It's a very well built camera and I have no complaints. Th quality of the photos are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Virtue

customer_reviews.title: I take amazing pics with it
customer_reviews.text: LOOOOOOVE this camera!! I take amazing pics with it, and everybody keep asking me what camera I use. I think 4 friends already bought exactly the same one. ALSO, it records great quality video (HD) and the built-in microphone is great, I don't need to use an external mic anymore. I do a lot of video recording for my company and this things is a shortcut and 2 in one that is hard to bit!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCand

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Canon SX40 is super easy to use. If you don't know anything about white balance and f-stops and the like you can use the "P" setting and let the camera make all those decisions for you. If you DO know something about photography, you can choose all the settings for yourself. 35X optical zoom is amazing, but you'd better have a very steady hand or use a tripod. And take the time to read the instructions if you want to get the most out of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for travel photography. Long ago, I used to have a 35mm film SLR with a variety of lenses. I have more fun with this camera because I don't need to carry around several lenses. Takes great digital pictures. I wish it had more video settings for slow motion videography. I also wish it had time-lapse capability. I love the 35X zoom. The newer SX50 has a larger zoom at 50X. I won't upgrade over the extra zoom but think new buyers should consider it versus the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Brian in Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I compared against the Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR and found it gave far superior results. Its staggering how good the combination of focusing, image stabilization and jpeg processing is at long tele settings. I wish it had focus priority for releasing the shutter, that the foussing was even faster, and that the viewfinder had higher resolution and magnification. I would like a manual or left hand zoom button. For tele, the power zoom is the slowest thing in the otherwise quick start-up. Used mostly for wildlife, with some amazing hand-held results.
customer_reviews.author: Tiga

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend a lot of money on pro camera, but also wanted one with Full HD movies. I was going to buy the P500 from Nikon, because the Canon SX30 is not full HD. When I came to buy it, I saw this one and didn't think twice, went with the SX40. Quality is MUCH better and the focus is really good. The only thing I wish this camera had was the panorama pic, but we can use the software to do it on pc.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Older camera so finding someone to fix it is going to be nearly IMPOSSIBLE
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first 6 months but then the microphones began to pick up extra sound so all you can hear in the videos is a fuzzy noise :( if you’re gonna spend $250 on a camera invest in a newer one or you’re gonna be throwing it away!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife has always taken incredible landscape photos and always uses Canon cameras. She was looking for one with a display as well as a view finder for those situations where you just can't see the display screen. We also didn't want to break the bank. This camera is perfect. Being able to rotate the display screen is a fantastic feature. It takes quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Hi quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. High quality easy to use. Clear pics. Haven’t tried the video yet. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best Canon I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic photos both wide angle and telephoto. Inside pics turned out perfect with low light, outside is just as good. I bought it for the ability to use a viewfinder in bright light outside. Trying to use the screen was useless under those conditions...great camera. .. great price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: DougdTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I am an art teacher but I have very limited background with photography, so I did some research to find a reasonably priced camera that was better than your average point and shoot but simpler than the professional DSLRs. This camera has been perfect for me. I am still exploring the settings and options but it is pretty user friendly and the pictures have all been coming out great.
customer_reviews.author: Pink_Elephant_Circus

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera - lens not clean
customer_reviews.text: I opened package, start charging battery, assembled strap and lens cover. Read "Getting started" guide. Battery seems ready (although not fully charged) so inserted battery and SD card (Amazon basic) and ... hmm, I found dirty spot on my brand new camera! I took couple of pictures anyway, and did not see much problem, but I want nice clean new lens so this one is going back. Since I was not able to replace it, immediately made another order. From few pictures I took, this is a nice camera! I never used this large camera but it definitely take a lot better picture than my old Exilim.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: A Birder's Delight!
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be the exact camera I was looking for to zoom in on distant birds on a lake or in a tree. Not at all shabby with birds in flight, either, and I've gotten some stunning photos with it. Have recently been using it for music videos to post on YouTube of my husband and my performances, and it does a great job with these, too. And I know I haven't even begun to tap into its potential...!
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that is a little step up from compact point-and-shoot but not heavy/bulky (and pricey) as DSLRs and this camera is perfect for my needs. I enjoy trying some settings other than autofocus. The image quality is great. I am by no means a pro photographer. I am a mom who is on the go and wants to be able to capture special moments/expressions of my son and the surrounding environment. I am happy with my camera.
customer_reviews.author: JTMcMom

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have a computerized telescope I never use any more .... I took pictures of the full moon, and at the edge you could see individual mountains and ranges. There are supposedly better cameras with better specs .... and being aware of that, I bought this one ...... Why? Canon CHDK ! It adds a thousand dollars of features to THIS camera.
customer_reviews.author: bruno

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife and she loves this ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she loves this thing. This replaced an older Canon camera with less pixels. She's not a tech savvy person and was able to use most of the controls without any help. Canon is continuing to supply high quality/user friendly cameras and photo software and we will continue buying them as long as they do.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd F. Bell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! Takes awesome quality pictures! Of course I am just an average person who went from a small digital camera and camera phone to this. It takes super clear pictures! I have taken pictures of my Grandkid, my dogs, the moon, even pictures in pitch dark! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Love Nature

customer_reviews.title: Portability and
customer_reviews.text: i bougth the Canon SX 40 about 1 year ago and have used it several times in different conditions. This camera has a good quality/price ratio, you can carry it for every where, it is practical and I can make good pictures in good light conditions. the zoom is amazing. You don't need anything else to shoot movies, movie's quality is great, image stabilization works as a charm and you can set up the camera for a variety of conditions. Its was a nice buy. After a while, I decided it was time to upgrade to SLR, but I am keeping my SX40 for portability (when compared to SLR not to other compact cameras) and movies.
customer_reviews.author: ROGER MARX

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this camera. We've never had an expensive camera, just the ones under $20, so this was considered a major investment for us. The seller was wonderful to work with and I'm hoping to do business with him again soon!! Best pictures we've ever taken!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna S. Russell

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I had an SX5 so this was a step up. I haven't had it long enough to really write a good detailed review but so far it is great. I did have to purchase the screen protector and polarized lens covers separately to protect it. The zoom is awesome - it handles well. My only beef so far is that they changed the on/off to a button and it is too easy to hit it while stowing in my camera bag which is irritating. product_meta.title: Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Canon 5251B001 PowerShot SX40 HS 12.1MP Black Compact Digital Camera is a versatile compact point-and-shoot camera that easily captures amazing photos and videos. The HS SYSTEM boosts low-light performance with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor and a high-sensitivity 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. The 35x Optical Zoom offers incredible reach and range, allowing you to shoot any scene, near or far. The camera also features a 2.7-inch Vari-angle LCD for great shooting flexibility. Packed with an array of powerful technologies, the PowerShot SX40 HS is a convenient digital camera capable of brilliant image capture.Built-in Flash Yes: Auto, Auto/Red-eye Reduction, FE Lock, Flash On, Off, Red-eye Reduction, Slow Sync.Effective Flash Range Wide: 1.6 - 23' (0.49 - 7.01 m),Telephoto: 4.6 - 9.8' (1.40 - 2.99 m).What's in the Box: PowerShot SX40 HS Body, Battery Pack NB-10L, Battery Charger CB-2LC, Lens Cap, Case for Hot Shoe Cap, Neck Strap NS-DC11, Interface Cable IFC-400PCU and Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Canon SX40 HS Zoom to Infinite Possibilities

The PowerShot SX40 HS is a versatile compact point-and-shoot camera that easily captures amazing photos and videos. The Canon HS SYSTEM boosts low-light performance with the new Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor and a high-sensitivity 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. This advanced Canon technology delivers stunning image quality with reduced noise and blur. Colors are more vibrant and white balance is true-to-life. The 35x Optical Zoom offers incredible reach and range, allowing you to shoot any scene, near or far. The Optical Image Stabilizer helps images come out steady and clear, and a 24mm ultra Wide-Angle lens makes it easy to take pictures of large groups of people, tall buildings, expansive landscapes and much more. The camera also features a 2.7-inch Vari-angle LCD for great shooting flexibility. Packed with an array of powerful technologies, the PowerShot SX40 HS is a convenient digital camera capable of brilliant image capture. 

Extreme 35x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom and 24mm Lens

The PowerShot SX40 HS is equipped with a Genuine Canon 35x Zoom lens that provides the telephoto power to bring your distant subjects incredibly close. It also features a useful zoom range that begins at 24mm wide-angle and extends to 840mm telephoto (35mm equivalent). The 24mm ultra Wide-Angle allows you to create shots with dramatic perspective and makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings. This superb lens delivers outstanding optical performance throughout its zoom range. It’s advanced design employs UD glass, double-sided aspherical glass-molded and ultra-high-refraction-index glass lens elements to effectively suppress chromatic aberration while maintaining a remarkably compact size. The camera uses a VCM (Voice Coil Motor) for high-speed, quiet, energy-efficient lens movement with precise control.

Optical Image Stabilizer

Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.

Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor



The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor brings phenomenal increases in processing speed and power. Improved chip architecture and algorithms deliver greatly expanded functionality with further refinement in image quality. 
Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. Enhanced i-Contrast performance adjusts differences between light and dark areas to achieve even more natural-looking results. 
The faster processing speed also results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor also makes possible a new, highly advanced automatic white balance system. Whereas conventional white balance makes an overall adjustment based on a single type of light source, the new Canon Multi-Area White Balance analyzes several areas of the image to determine whether different adjustments are needed, for example, for the main subject and the background. 
Noise Reduction
Conventional Image Processor
White Balance
With DIGIC 5 Image Processor


Canon HS SYSTEM

The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 12.1 Megapixel Canon CMOS sensor in the PowerShot SX40 HS incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The new DIGIC 5 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of ISO 3200. The Canon HS SYSTEM thus lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur. 



Memorable Moments in Spectacular Full HD
In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor in the PowerShot SX40 HS makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. The PowerShot SX40 HS shoots Full HD video at 24* frames per second, ensuring clear lifelike motion images with a beautiful cinematic quality. It also shoots beautifully detailed 720p HD video at 30 fps.**
*Actual frame rate is 23.976 fps.
**Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.


 Dedicated Movie Button, Wind Filter and Optical Zoom While Shooting


It’s never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot SX40 HS has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot SX40 HS also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot SX40 HS lets you use the full range of optical zoom when you’re shooting a video.



 HDTV Playback via HDMI with CEC Support




It’s easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot SX40 HS. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable (not included). And because the PowerShot SX40 HS supports HDMI-CEC technology, you’ll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TV’s remote control. (CEC – Consumer Electronic Control – is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)


iFrame Movie Support 
With the PowerShot SX40 HS, you can also shoot video in the Apple™ iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions. 




Vari-Angle LCD

The PowerShot SX40 HS features a convenient and highly useful 2.7-inch Vari-Angle LCD screen that swivels out almost a full 180 degrees. It also rotates through approximately 270 degrees, letting you tilt it up or down to shoot at low or high angles. You can compose freely even when shooting from difficult vantage points and use the full range of angle adjustment even when the camera is mounted on a tripod. You can even rotate the LCD facing forward to capture perfectly framed self-portraits and to join group shots. The PureColor System LCD screen has 230,000 dots, giving you a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient. 


A Steady Image is a Beautiful Image

Intelligent IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.



Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Hybrid
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. 

Modes/Special Scene Modes Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer.
Manual
You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually.
Aperture-Priority
You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-Priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise.
Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Smart AUTO
The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity.
Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video. Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.” Kids & Pets Reduced focusing time freezes fast-moving subjects, so you won't miss those special shots. Landscape
Increases depth-of-field for sharp and sweeping landscape shots.
Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Capture fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down.
Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod.
Beach Beach Get clear shots of people at a sunny beach without darkened faces. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required.
Foliage
Capture brilliant shots of autumn foliage, greenery and blossoms.
Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint.
Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist
Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos.
Creative Filters
This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. 
High Dynamic Range
The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image.
Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Fisheye Effect Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Nostalgic
Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white.
Fisheye Effect
Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid
Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Movie The camera takes five photos in succession, and then chooses the best one out of the bunch.
Super Slow Motion Movie
Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality.
